greatMindsCards.charDescription: <insert generic boring speech>

greatMindsCards.name: Ada Lovelace
greatMindsCards.charDescription: That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal

greatMindsCards.name: Florence Nightingale
greatMindsCards.charDescription: I'd rather die in the surf than stand idly at the shore

greatMindsCards.name: Plato
greatMindsCards.charDescription: The measure of a man is what he does with power

greatMindsCards.name: Pythagoras
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Reason is immortal, all else mortal

greatMindsCards.name: Galileo
greatMindsCards.charDescription: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox

greatMindsCards.name: David Attenborough
greatMindsCards.charDescription: He's Blown It

greatMindsCards.name: Thomas Edison
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits

greatMindsCards.name: Leonardo De Vinci
greatMindsCards.charDescription: The smallest feline is a masterpiece

greatMindsCards.name: Christopher Colombus
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Following the light of the sun we left the old world

greatMindsCards.name: Ludwig Van Beethoven
greatMindsCards.charDescription: I want to seize fate by the throat

greatMindsCards.name: Benjamin Franklin
greatMindsCards.charDescription: You may delay but time will not

greatMindsCards.name: Isaac Newton
greatMindsCards.charDescription: To every action there is an equal and opposite reaction

greatMindsCards.name: Alan Turing
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Machines take me by suprise with great frequency

greatMindsCards.name: Nikola Tesla
greatMindsCards.charDescription: The present is theirs; the future for which I really worked is mine

greatMindsCards.name: Charles Darwin
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Whoever is the most responsive to change survives

greatMindsCards.name: Martin Luther King
greatMindsCards.charDescription: I have a dream!

greatMindsCards.name: Marie Curie
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Humanity will draw more good than evil from new discoveries

greatMindsCards.name: Albert Einstein
greatMindsCards.charDescription: Education remains when school is forgotten

greatMindsCards.name: William Shakespeare
greatMindsCards.charDescription: That is the question

greatMindsCards.name: Ghandi
greatMindsCards.charDescription: You must be the change you wish to see in the world

evilLeaderCards.charDescription: I'm in love with a rose with no thorn

evilLeaderCards.charDescription: The universities are available to those who share my beliefs

evilLeaderCards.charDescription: The truth is that men are tired of liberty

evilLeaderCards.name: Shaka Zulu
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: Strike an enemy once and for all

evilLeaderCards.name: Alexander The Great
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: There is nothing impossible to him who will try

evilLeaderCards.name: Lenin
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: A lie told often enough becomes the truth

evilLeaderCards.name: Queen Victoria
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: We will not have failure - only success and new learning

evilLeaderCards.name: Mao
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: Communism is a hammer we use to crush the enemy

evilLeaderCards.name: Atilla The Hun
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: Trample the weak, Hurdle the dead

evilLeaderCards.name: Kim Jong Il
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: National Security is our sacred duty

evilLeaderCards.name: Napolean
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake

evilLeaderCards.name: Genghis Khan
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: If you're afraid - dont do it. If you're doing it - dont be afraid

evilLeaderCards.name: Margaret Thatcher
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: A battle may be fought more than once to win it

evilLeaderCards.name: Hitler
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: Who owns the youth gains the future

evilLeaderCards.name: Stalin
evilLeaderCards.charDescription: A million deaths is a statistic
